thread.title: Jones knew 'at the beginning' Canales was right fit for Vols
thread.title_full: Jones knew 'at the beginning' Canales was right fit for Vols

title: Jones knew 'at the beginning' Canales was right fit for Vols
text: Manage Jones knew 'at the beginning' Canales was right fit for Vols Even before Tennessee coach Butch Jones began interviewing candidates last month to find a new quarterbacks coach, he admittedly knew he would end up hiring Mike Canales. Slot to Tennessee Links New Tennessee quarterbacks coach Mike Canales (Photo: Tennessee athletics, UTSports.com) Even before Tennessee coach Butch Jones began interviewing candidates last month to find a new quarterbacks coach, he had a feeling he would end up hiring Mike Canales . Jones said last week that he "knew it at the beginning" that Canales, a veteran coach and longtime friend of Jones, would be his choice, although the Vols talked with 10 different candidates about the opening created by former offensive coordinator Mike DeBord 's departure. The only question in Jones' mind, he said, was whether the rest of his staff would be convinced that Canales, who spent last season at Utah State, was the man for the job. In the end, they were. (What's next for the Vols? Make sure you're in the loop — take five seconds to sign up for our FREE Vols newsletter now!) “Just so you know, I interviewed 10 quarterback coaches — five from the National Football League, five from college football," Jones said last week during Tennessee's National Signing Day celebration at Tennessee Theatre. "His nickname is ‘Chico.’ We put ‘Chico’ through the wringer. We made him come in twice on an interview. But I knew it at the beginning, that it would be him. But I wanted him to prove it to everyone, and bringing him in twice, and all of our staff was a part of it. "It was unanimous that he was the best fit for the University of Tennessee.” BUY ONE MONTH, GET TWO MONTHS FREE to get VIP access to GoVols247. Author
